description: North Macedonia changed the hours of curfew for different segments of society. Adults over age 67 are allowed out between 5AM and 11AM. Individuals under 18 years old are allowed out from 12PM to 8PM. Everyone is restricted from movement outside their homes from 9PM to 5AM starting on March 24th.

North Macedonia changed the hours of curfew for different segments of society. Adults over age 67 are allowed out between 5AM and 11AM. Individuals under 18 years old are allowed out from 12PM to 8PM. Everyone is restricted from movement outside their homes from 9PM to 5AM starting on March 24th. UPDATE: Curfew hours were changed. Individuals over 67 years old are allowed outside their houses between 5AM and 11AM. Individuals under 18 years old are allowed outside their houses between 12PM and 9PM only. No one is allowed outside their houses from 9PM to 5AM.
North Macedonia changed curfew times for Saturday and Sunday from 9PM to 5AM to 4PM to 5AM starting on March 28th.

North Macedonia changed curfew times for Saturday and Sunday from 9PM to 5AM to 4PM to 5AM starting on March 28th. UPDATE: Quarantine will be 4PM to 5AM on Saturdays and Sundays starting on March 28th.

On April 8, curfew hours were extended in the municipality of Kumanovo in North Macedonia and the surrounding villages to limit the spread of the coronavirus in the region. From Monday to Friday, individuals are prohibited from leaving their homes between 16:00 and 05:00 (local time). Over the weekend, a complete ban on movement will be implemented from 21:00 on Friday through 05:00 on Monday.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: North Macedonia is changing weekly curfew hours starting on April 8th. Individuals over 67 years of age can leave their houses from 10AM to 12PM. Individuals under 18 years of age, will be aloud outside their houses from 1PM to 3PM. All other adults will have a curfew of 4PM to 5AM.
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

description: North Macedonia is enforcing a weekend curfew starting on Friday April 10th. Curfew will extend from Fridays at 4PM until Monday mornings at 5AM. UPDATE: A weekend curfew has been set from Fridays at 4PM until Mondays at 5AM.
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

description: North Macedonia will be relaxing curfew restrictions from May 1st through 3rd. New curfew hours will be from 2PM until 5AM on the next day. Adults over 67 years old can move from 5AM to 11AM. Children up to age 18 can leave their houses from 12PM to 2PM. UPDATE: North Macedonia will be relaxing curfew hours during the May 1st holidays.
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

description: North Macedonian authorities have issued a daily nationwide curfew which is now in place between the hours of 19:00 and 05:00 on May 15.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: During the public holiday weekend from 23-25 May, in North Macedonia, curfew will face modifications: on 24 May, curfew hours will begin at 11.00 and will end on 26 May at 05.00.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From March 26, North Macedonia will resume to regular curfews: A curfew is in place from 19.00 to 05.00. On Saturdays and Sundays, those older than 67 can only move between 05.00 and 12.00 and those younger than 18 from 13.00 to 19.00.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From March 26, North Macedonia will resume to regular curfews: A curfew is in place from 19.00 to 05.00. On Saturdays and Sundays, those older than 67 can only move between 05.00 and 12.00 and those younger than 18 from 13.00 to 19.00. UPDATE: National curfew lifted. On Wednesday, May 27, the nationwide curfew in place amid the ongoing coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic was ended.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Except Skopje, all other municipalities in North Macedonia, a curfew has been implemented from 9:00 pm, June 4 until 5:00 am, June 5.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On June 5, 6, and 7, in North Macedonia, curfew hours will last from 4:00 pm until 5:00 am the following day.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: The Country of North Macedonia issued a state of emergency for 30 days starting on March 18th, 2020.
The Country of North Macedonia issued a state of emergency for at least 30 days starting on March 18th, 2020. UPDATE: The state of emergency since March 18 was ended on June 12.
North Macedonia’s president has declared an eight-day state of emergency from June 16.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: North Macedonia’s president has declared an eight-day state of emergency from June 16. UPDATE: States of emergency was extended until August 31, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In North Macedonia, preventive measures will be taken and from Jan 27: passengers on flights from Istanbul and Dubai, which have a connection with China, will be scanned with a thermal camera.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: In North Macedonia, public transport will be suspended during the curfew from March 22.

description: North Macedonia will have a lockdown from Friday April 17th until Tuesday April 21st.

description: North Macedonia relaxing weekend quarantine hours. Now the hours will be 3PM on Saturdays until 5AM on Mondays. UPDATE: North Macedonia is relaxing quarantine times to 3PM on Saturdays to 5AM on Mondays.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Government of North Macedonia has ordered a full 80-hour lockdown of the capital Skopje, and the towns of Tetovo, Kumanovo and Štip from Jun 4.

description: North Macedonia's Ministry of Health should establish a permanent public information center, which aims to collect all relevant information in order to inform the public about the prevention of coronavirus, as well as the treatment of the virus.

description: North Macedonia  began mandating a 14 day self-isolation for all passengers arriving from high to mid risky states.

description: Officials in North Macedonia announced on Wednesday, March 4, that gatherings of more than 500 people would be prohibited until further notice due to the ongoing coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: North Macedonia banned all mass gatherings over 1,000. All sporting events are to be played indoors without an audience.
The Government of North Macedonia has prohibited visits to all cemeteries in the country from 9:00 pm June 4 to 5:00 am June 8 except for funerals.

description: Gathering in public places is permitted while practicing social distancing and wearing protective masks.

description: In North Macedonia, Government introduces mandatory face mask measure for public spaces as of April 23.

description: In North Macedonia, from Apr 29, individuals must practice two-meter social distancing in public and wear a protective face covering in closed public spaces, including markets, shops, banks, post offices, health facilities, and public transport, as well as in open spaces where it is not possible to maintain a two-meter distance.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
